FAQ_WP_SPAM_MIGRATE: Can I migrate my existing WordPress comments?
FAQ_WP_SPAM_MIGRATE_ANSWER: Yes. The FastComments WordPress plugin includes a one-click import that brings over all your existing comments, including nested threads, author information, and timestamps. The migration typically completes in under a minute for most sites.
FAQ_WP_SPAM_AKISMET: How does FastComments compare to Akismet?
FAQ_WP_SPAM_AKISMET_ANSWER: Akismet is a spam filter that sits on top of the default WordPress comment system. FastComments replaces the entire comment system with a purpose-built platform that includes multiple layers of spam protection (AI classifiers, trust scoring, bot blocking, profanity filters), plus features like real-time commenting, SSO, and detailed moderation tools. It's a complete solution, not just a filter.
FAQ_WP_SPAM_SEO_ANSWER: No. FastComments syncs comments back to your WordPress database daily, so search engines continue to index your comment content. Comments are also rendered in a way that is accessible to crawlers.
FAQ_WP_SPAM_WOOCOMMERCE_ANSWER: Yes. FastComments fully supports WooCommerce product reviews and comment threads. Spam protection applies to all comment types across your store.
FAQ_WP_SPAM_MULTISITE: Can I use it on a WordPress multi-site network?
FAQ_WP_SPAM_MULTISITE_ANSWER: Yes. Since WordPress uses numeric page IDs, you should create a separate tenant in your FastComments account for each site to keep comments separated. Moderation is centralized across all tenants, and each site gets full spam protection.
FAQ_WP_SPAM_SPEED: Will FastComments slow down my site?
FAQ_WP_SPAM_SPEED_ANSWER: No. FastComments loads asynchronously and is served from a global CDN. It's typically faster than the default WordPress comment system because it offloads comment rendering and spam processing from your server.
